description: The 'Blue Pearl' known for its vibrant blue-washed houses and narrow streets in the Rif Mountains.
name: Chefchaouen

description: One of the largest mosques in the world, featuring intricate tilework, a retractable roof, and stunning ocean views.
name: Hassan II Mosque

description: A bustling central square in Marrakech, filled with food stalls, snake charmers, acrobats, and a variety of local performers.
name: Jemaa el-Fnaa

description: Dramatic canyons carved by the Dades River, offering scenic hikes, waterfalls, and kasbahs (traditional fortified villages).
name: Dades Gorges

description: Roman ruins of an ancient city, showcasing impressive mosaics, temples, and triumphal arches.
name: Volubilis

description: Vast desert landscape with towering sand dunes, popular for camel trekking and stargazing under clear skies.
name: Erg Chebbi Sand Dunes

description: A spectacular canyon with towering cliffs along the Todgha River, perfect for hiking and exploring.
name: Tinghir Todgha Gorge

description: A laid-back coastal town with beautiful beaches, a relaxed atmosphere, and a well-preserved medina (old town).
name: Essaouira

description: The tallest waterfalls in Morocco, surrounded by lush greenery and offering breathtaking views.
name: Ouzoud Waterfalls

description: A 17th-century fortress with beautiful gardens and panoramic views of the blue-washed city.
name: Chefchaouen Kasbah
